metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0305 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In cdev_get of char_dev.c, there is a possible use-after-free due to a race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android-10Android ID: A-153467744

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0305` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-91-generic - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-4.15.0-91-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-4.15.0-91-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-91-generic - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-91-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1063-aws - 4.15.0-1063.67
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-91.92').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1063.67').
